snippet: Two of the National Rifle Association’s favorites in the Senate came together in a last-ditch effort on a background check deal that opened the door for Congress to consider new gun laws.
abstract: Sens Joe Manchin III and Patrick J Toomey, longtime favorites of National Rifle Assn, come together in last-ditch bipartisan effort on background check proposal that could open door for Congress to consider new gun laws; proposed legislation will expand background checks to cover unlicensed dealers at gun shows as well as all online sales.

byline.contributor: Monica Davey contributed reporting from Chicago.

lead_paragraph: Two of the National Rifle Association’s favorites in the Senate came together in a last-ditch effort on a background check deal that opened the door for Congress to consider new gun laws.

headline.seo: Manchin and Toomey Reach Gun Bill Compromise
headline.main: A Senator’s Search for an Ally Keeps a Gun Bill Alive
headline.print_headline: Senator’s Search for Ally Keeps Gun Bill Alive
